text: Shahe River () , also known as Xianing River (), is a right-bank tributary of Xiang River in Hunan, China. It rises in Fenshui'ao (), Chuanshanping Town, southwest of Miluo City, The river runs Qiaoyi Town and Dingziwan Subdistrict of Wangcheng District and Qingzhuhu Subdistrict of Kaifu District through Changsha before linking up with the Xiang River.part of the title, translation from the Baidu encyclopaedia, see baike (Baidu encyclopaedia) The Shahe is a river无名污水染黑沙河: xxcb.cn or voc.com.cn (16-Aug-12) in the east bank of Xiang River, which flows westward from Miluo and joins the Xiang at Xianinggang (). The drainage basin of the Shahe River is . The river flows generally from north to south. The source of the river is on high ground near the south of seat of Chuanshanping Town, from whence it runs south, very close to and almost parallel with the Beijing–Guangzhou Railway which is located on the eastern side of the river. On the western bank of Shahe River, a road runs all along, the section of the levee road in Miluo is county route X059, that of which in Wangcheng District of Changsha is county route X056 or X057.the geography on the Shahe River, according to the webmap, see webmap.cn ==References== Category:Miluo City Category:Wangcheng District Category:Kaifu District Category:Rivers of Changsha
title: Shahe River (Xiang River tributary)
